info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 9:04AM CDT until May 8 at 11:52AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
East Cache Creek near Walters affecting Cotton and Comanche Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Cache Creek near Walters.
* WHEN...From late tonight to late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Valley-wide flooding of croplands... pastures... and local roads occurs in southern Comanche County and Cotton County and is accompanied by flood depths up to 4 feet with swift currents.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The East Cache Creek is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 25.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
